page.title: 17CHANGES IN PATTERNS OF TRADE
page.content: Despite efforts by the district council to attract traders and customers, Bromsgrove in the 1980's has seen a sharp change in the range and character of shops and business premises. Empty shops, frequent changes of tenure and major changes in the use of buildings in High Street testify to the difficulties resulting from economic recession and competition from the new shopping centre in Redditch. Furniture stores, menswear shops, butchers' and supermarkets have all closed, while banks have flourished and building societies have increased in number. {"Shop to Let"}signs are commonplace. Even the council offices are for sale as they are removed to the now redundant college of education buildings.
